artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Takabatake Ransen; Publisher: Inoue Mohei
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 370.8; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 250, p. 282.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman lying on her stomach, reading a page of text, with an orange and white cat sitting on top of a short brown and black chest at left; woman wears a brown kimono with black checks; mounted on moderately stiff backing paper
inscription: 「出て三日人なら如何に猫の恋。と故人もいひし早咲の。梅も盛のつく頃に。隅田の上流の夜泊は。足もと暗き朧月に。顔をそむけて忍びがへし。浮雲くわたる糸爪を研や。遂ずや、挑まれつ争みつ狂ふ恋中を。嗅出されては最う仮名読の、先生実に情けないといはん　転々堂主人戯誌」.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From A Collection of Desires (Mitate tai zukushi 見立多以盡)
signed: 応需大蘇芳年 {ōju Taiso Yoshitoshi}
title: I want to cancel my subscription
